block.p: LEAD: The Chrysler Auto Receivables Company offered $1 billion worth of securities backed by retail installment contracts on new or used autos and light trucks through an underwriting syndicate led by Merrill Lynch Capital Markets. The 8 3/4 percent securities, which have a final maturity of Aug. 15, 1995, were priced at $99.718, to yield 8.856 percent, which is 77 basis points, or hundredths of a percentage point, over the prevailing yield on the when-issued two-year Treasury notes at the time of pricing.

LEAD: The Chrysler Auto Receivables Company offered $1 billion worth of securities backed by retail installment contracts on new or used autos and light trucks through an underwriting syndicate led by Merrill Lynch Capital Markets. The 8 3/4 percent securities, which have a final maturity of Aug. 15, 1995, were priced at $99.718, to yield 8.856 percent, which is 77 basis points, or hundredths of a percentage point, over the prevailing yield on the when-issued two-year Treasury notes at the time of pricing.

The Chrysler Auto Receivables Company offered $1 billion worth of securities backed by retail installment contracts on new or used autos and light trucks through an underwriting syndicate led by Merrill Lynch Capital Markets. The 8 3/4 percent securities, which have a final maturity of Aug. 15, 1995, were priced at $99.718, to yield 8.856 percent, which is 77 basis points, or hundredths of a percentage point, over the prevailing yield on the when-issued two-year Treasury notes at the time of pricing. The expected final maturity for the asset-backed securities is July 15, 1993. Ratings of AAA are expected from Moody's Investors Service and the Standard & Poor's Corporation.
